title: Encyclopaedia of Ireland Cover font, LTC Californian
content:
Anyone know if the: "The", and "of" on this cover are set in "LTC Californian"? or what else could it be?

[http://www.clarelibrary.ie/eolas/library/images/encyc\_irl.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20101015090054/http:/www.clarelibrary.ie/eolas/library/images/encyc_irl.jpg "http://www.clarelibrary.ie/eolas/library/images/encyc\_irl.jpg")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-californian/display-italic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20101015090054/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-californian/display-italic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-californian/display-italic/")
author: DermotHall

comments.content: No, I would bet on a much more common font, the '80s revival of Californian, [ITC Berkeley Oldstyle](http://web.archive.org/web/20101015090054/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/itc_berkeley_oldstyle_book_italic/&sample_text=The%20of%20&sample_size=96).
Thanks Stephen, I just loaded it up, what a beautiful font
